meanings.definition: A quality of being pleasantly stimulating or exciting
meanings.sent1: The piquance of the music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent2: The piquance of the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The piquance of the surprise party was evident in everyone's smiles.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter added a piquance to the conversation, making it more enjoyable.
meanings.sent5: The piquance of the adventure left a lasting impression on them.

meanings.sent1: The chef added just the right amount of piquance to the dish.

meanings.sent5: The piquance of the curry lingered on his tongue.

meanings.definition: A feeling of irritation or resentment
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide the piquance in her voice when she spoke about the issue.
meanings.sent2: The piquance in the room was palpable after the argument.
meanings.sent3: His piquance towards the situation was evident in his clenched fists.
meanings.sent4: The piquance in her expression showed that she was upset.
meanings.sent5: The piquance in the air made it clear that tensions were high.
